atg.repository.databinding
Class MappingManager

java.lang.Object
  atg.nucleus.GenericService
      atg.repository.databinding.MappingManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdminableService, ApplicationLogging, ComponentNameResolver, org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler, java.util.EventListener, NameContextBindingListener, NameContextElement, NameResolver, Service, ServiceListener
public class MappingManager
extends GenericService
implements org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler

This class maintains a pointer to a directory that contains mapping files that live on a virtual file system. Users can request access to one of these mapping files by logical name. This logical name corresponds to the name of the mapping file itself. The contents of the file will be returned to the user as a parsed tree that contains ItemMappingElementItemMappingElements and PropertyMappingElementPropertyMappingElements.

The mapping files are expected to conform to the itemDescriptorMapping DTD.

As an example, if a user wanted to specify a mapping file for the Profile item-descriptor that lives in the /atg/userprofiling/ProfileAdapterRepository and declare that the "scenarios" property should not be excluded in the datamodel to be exported then the following would be done.

  • Define the mapping file. The mapping file would look like
    <item-descriptor repository="/atg/userprofiling/ProfileAdapterRepository" name="profile">
    <property name="scenarios" include="false"/>
    <
    The file could be named ProfileMapping
  • Place the mapping file into the directory pointed to by this Mapping Manager component. For example, this could be {atg.dynamo.root}/mappingFiles
  • Application that want access to this mapping file would invoke the #getMapping(String)getMapping() method on this class passing in the name of the mapping file as the argument. i.e. ProfileMapping This component would then return the contents of the file parsed as set of Java objects. The top level object returned would be an instance of the ItemMappingElement class.

    See Also:
    ItemMappingElement, PropertyMappingElement

    getMappingFileExtension

    public java.lang.String getMappingFileExtension()
    The extension that is expected to be on mapping files. Defaults to ".xml"

    Returns:
    String the extension for mapping files

    setMappingFileExtension

    Parameters:
    mappingFileExtension - The mappingFileExtension to set

    isParseMappingsOnStartup

    public boolean isParseMappingsOnStartup()
    Whether or not the mapping files that this component points to should be parsed on start-up. In a production site, the mapping files should be parsed on start-up so as to avoid the performance hit the first time that a mapping file is parsed. For a development situation, it might be desirable to not have the files parsed on start-up, thus enabling faster start-up times.

    This property defaults to false.

    Returns:
    true if mapping files should be parsed on start-up.

    setParseMappingsOnStartup

    public void setParseMappingsOnStartup(boolean pParseMappingsOnStartup)
    Set the parseMappingsOnStartup property.

    Parameters:
    pParseMappingsOnStartup -

    getMappingFileDirectories

    public java.io.File[] getMappingFileDirectories()
    A set of directories can be specified that mapping files will be obtained from. If there are mapping files with the same name that appear in multiple directories, those mapping files will use XML Combination and be combined into a single mapping file.

    This property should be used as opposed to the mappingFileDirectory because of the ability to specify multiple directories.

    If values for this property are specified in addition to the mappingFileDirectory, then files will be obtained from both the directories associated with the mappingFileDirectories as well as the mappingFileDirectory property.

    Returns:
    File[] the set of directories that will be searched for mapping files.

    setMappingFileDirectories

    public void setMappingFileDirectories(java.io.File[] pMappingFileDirectories)
    Sets property MappingFileDirectories

    Parameters:
    pMappingFileDirectories -

    getMappingFileDirectory

    public java.io.File getMappingFileDirectory()
    Deprecated. 

    This property has been deprecated, the mappingFileDirectories property should be used instead since it allows the user to specify multiple directories.

    The directory in which mapping files will be stored. When this component is asked to obtain a parsed mapping file, it will resolve the logical name for the mapping file relative to this directory.

    Returns:
    the mapping file directory

    doStartService

    public void doStartService()
                    throws ServiceException
    This method will determine if the mapping files pointed to by this component should be parsed on start-up. If they should be parsed on start-up, then it will get a list of all files pointed to by this component and call getMapping() method with the file name thus placing them in the cache.

    The list of files that are pointed to by this component is determined by invoking the getMappingFileNames() method.

    Overrides:
    doStartService in class GenericService
    Throws:
    ServiceException - if an error occurs

    getMapping

    public atg.repository.databinding.ItemMappingElement getMapping(java.lang.String pMappingFileName)
                                                         throws MappingException
    This method will retrieve a parsed tree of mapping file information for a given mapping file. The parameter to this method should be the name of the file that the mapping file lives in. This filename is resolved relative to the mappingFileDirectory property on this class.

    This method will check for a mapping file that lives in the cache keyed by pMappingFileName parameter. If no entry is found in the cache then this method will resolve the file and parse it into a configuration tree.

    Parameters:
    pMappingFileName - the name of the mapping file to parse relative to the mappingFileDirectory parameter.
    Returns:
    the top-leve ItemMappingElement that appears in the mapping file
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if an error occurs
    MappingException - if an error occurs during the processing of a mapping file.

    buildItemMappingElement

    public atg.repository.databinding.ItemMappingElement buildItemMappingElement(org.w3c.dom.Element pItemElement,
                                                                             RepositoryItemDescriptor pDescriptor)
                                                                      throws MappingException,
                                                                             RepositoryException
    This method will build a single node in the mapping configuration tree. First, it creates a new ItemMappingElement and then it parses the XML element passed in as the pItemElement parameter. It will call the populateItemMappingProperties() method to populate all of the properties from the pItemElement to the ItemMappingElement.

    Finally, it will iterator over all the child element tags of pItemElement. For each child element which is a property tag it will ensure that property referred to by this child element is a legal property on the item-descriptor that the pItemElement referred to. If a legal property element is found, the buildPropertyMappingElement() method is called. The buildPropertyMappingElement() can recursively call the buildItemMappingElement() method thus allowing the creation of the entire mapping configuration tree.

    When this method completes, a tree of objects that will be generated which reflects all of the mapping information from the mapping elements and the properties pointed to by each item-descriptor element will be verified to exist on the actual item-descriptor in the repository.

    Parameters:
    pItemElement - XML element from mapping configuration file
    pDescriptor - item-descriptor referred to by the pItemElement
    Returns:
    created ItemMappingElement that reflects all information from the pItemElement.
    Throws:
    MappingException - if an error occurs
    RepositoryException

    buildPropertyMappingElement

    public atg.repository.databinding.PropertyMappingElement buildPropertyMappingElement(org.w3c.dom.Element pPropertyElement,
                                                                                     RepositoryItemDescriptor pDescriptor)
                                                                              throws MappingException,
                                                                                     RepositoryException
    This method will build a single PropertyMappingElement object which reflects all of the information contained within the pPropertyElement parameter.

    This method will create a new PropertyMappingElement and then call the populatePropertyMappingProperties() method to copy properties from the pPropertyElement to the create PropertyMappingElement.

    It will then walk all children element tags defined from the pPropertyElement. For each child tag, it will first ensure that the item-descriptor type mentioned in the element tag is assignable to the property. If it is, then the buildItemMappingElement method will be called.

    Parameters:
    pPropertyElement - the property element from the mapping config file
    pDescriptor - the item-descriptor that the property referred to by the pPropertyElement refers to
    Returns:
    newly created PropertyMappingElement containing information copied from the pPropertyElement
    Throws:
    MappingException
    RepositoryException

    getMappingInputStream

    protected java.io.InputStream getMappingInputStream(java.lang.String pMappingFileName)
                                             throws MappingException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
    This method returns the input stream that is associated with the specified mapping file.

    Parameters:
    pMappingFileName - the name of the mapping file to return the InputStream to. This filename is resolved relative to the mappingFileDirectory.
    Throws:
    MappingException - if an error occured while trying to access the mappingInputStream.
    java.io.IOException

    clearCache

    public void clearCache()
    This method can be used to clear the cache that is maintained internally by this class. After this class parses a file the first time, it will cache the parsed contents in memory so that future requests do not require a parse operation.

    If this cache needs to be cleared (because a file changed on the system for example) this method can be invoked and the cache will be reset.

    getDocumentObject

    protected org.w3c.dom.Document getDocumentObject(java.io.InputStream pInputStream)
                                          throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                 org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                 java.io.IOException
    Utility method which will return the inputstream as a Document object to us. It performs validation on the parsing of the document.

    Parameters:
    pInputStream - input stream that contains a mapping instance document
    Returns:
    the Document which is the parsed instance document
    Throws:
    javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
    org.xml.sax.SAXException
    java.io.IOException

    populateItemMappingProperties

    public void populateItemMappingProperties(atg.repository.databinding.ItemMappingElement pItemMapping,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Element pItemElement,
                                          RepositoryItemDescriptor pDescriptor)
                                   throws MappingException,
                                          RepositoryException
    This method populates the ItemMappingElement object passed to it with two properties
    • the repository defined on the pElement
    • the item-descriptor defined on the pElement
    If the repository or item-descriptor is not defined on the pElement passed to this method then the values will be set to null.

    Parameters:
    pItemMapping - an ItemMappingElement value
    pDescriptor - the RepositoryItemDescriptor that the ItemMappingElement backs.
    Throws:
    MappingException
    RepositoryException

    populatePropertyMappingProperties

    public void populatePropertyMappingProperties(atg.repository.databinding.PropertyMappingElement pPropertyMapping,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Element pElement)
    This method populates the PropertyMappingElement object passed to it with three properties
    • the include information from the pElement That is, whether or not the property associated with this object should be included in the externalized data-model
    • the property name as it should appear in the item-descriptor (name)
    • the property name as it should appear in the target datamodel

    Any values not specified in the xml mapping file will be set to null.

    Parameters:
    pElement - an Element value

    getRepository

    public Repository getRepository(org.w3c.dom.Element pElement)
                         throws MappingException
    Given an element, try to extract the path to a Nucleus repository component. From this path, look-up the component in Nucleus and return this to the caller.

    The pElement parameter passed to this method is expected to have an attribute on it whose name matches the repository path constant defined on this class.

    Parameters:
    pElement - the element that a repository path will be extracted from
    Returns:
    the resolved Repository, null if no repository defined on item
    Throws:
    MappingException - if an error occurs

    getItemDescriptor

    public RepositoryItemDescriptor getItemDescriptor(Repository pRepository,
                                                  org.w3c.dom.Element pElement)
                                           throws MappingException,
                                                  RepositoryException
    This method will retrieve the item-descriptor that is specified on the element passed to this method that is defined in the repository passed to this method.

    The pElement parameter passed to this method is expected to have an attribute on it whose name matches the item-descriptor name constant defined on this class.

    Parameters:
    pRepository - the repository that the item-descriptor is defined in
    pElement - the element that contains the item-descriptor name
    Returns:
    the RepositoryItemDescriptor that was found in the repository
    Throws:
    MappingException - if an error occurs
    RepositoryException

    isItemDescriptorValidForProperty

    public boolean isItemDescriptorValidForProperty(RepositoryItemDescriptor pItemDescriptor,
                                                java.lang.String pPropertyName,
                                                RepositoryItemDescriptor pMapElementItemDescriptor)
                                         throws RepositoryException
    This method determines if the item-descriptor which was specified in the mapping file refers to an item-descriptor type that is valid for the target property on the item-descriptor defined in the repository.

    It will check to make sure that the target property does not point to a property which is a simple type. It then will check the target property and all of its possible subtype item-descriptors to see if there is a match against the item-desc passed.

    Parameters:
    pItemDescriptor - the item-descriptor defined in a repository whose property is currently being operated on
    pPropertyName - the property that is being modified in some way
    pMapElementItemDescriptor - the item-descriptor that comes from the mapping file
    Returns:
    true if the item-descriptor type defined in the mapping file is assignable to the property being modified by the mapping file
    Throws:
    RepositoryException

    getMappingFileNames

    public java.lang.String[] getMappingFileNames()
                                       throws MappingException
    Rturns a list of the mapping files that this component points to.

    Returns:
    array of filenames pointed to by this component
    Throws:
    MappingException

    parseAllFiles

    public void parseAllFiles()
                   throws RepositoryException,
                          MappingException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                          org.xml.sax.SAXException
    Parse all the mapping files that are pointed to by this component. Every file will be parsed again and added to the cache.

    This method does not clear the cache before parsing files. So, if a change has been made to mapping file and those changes should be detected, the clearCache() method should be invoked.

    Throws:
    RepositoryException - if an error occurs
    MappingException - if an error occurs
    java.io.IOException - if an error occurs
    javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if an error occurs
    org.xml.sax.SAXException - if an error occurs
